with the Al Shaedy bus company take about 7 or 8 hours with a stop in

. Buses in both direction leave once daily at sunrise. They cost around tsh10,000.

Buses from

with Amani bus company take about 3 hours and cost tsh4000-6000 one way.

You can also use Kimambo buses to travel to Dodoma the price is the same.  Both companies are friendly and will send you to the other if their bus leaves at a better time.  Buses run roughly every few hours.
It is small enough to walk around Mpwapwa or you can get a cab.
Food is pretty basic in Mpwapwa but you can always get a tasty Chipsi Mayai (Chip Omlette)
Serves  basics like rice, ugali, Fish, Chicken and Beef.  Menu depends on what they have in.  Good value tsh 1500-2500 for Chicken and rice.
Serves pretty much the same range as Silver.

Tap water is not safe unless boiled or filtered.  Bottle water is available and costs about tsh700 for for 1.5 litres.

Soft drinks 'Sodas' are available and cost tsh400

Beer is served in most places and prices for local beers such as Safari and Tusker are around tsh1200
Sigle room in hotel for 7000 Tsh, 15000 Tsh with own bathroom, forgot  the name of the hotel, will add it later

The is a posta in town, follow the big arial.  Closes around 4.30pm

Mpwapwa Teacher Training College provides Internet for tsh500 for half an hour and tsh500 for printing pp.
